author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> FYI to every EL client who looks at Benchmarking dashboard.

We made a decision to change the approach slightly.

For now we will not be running multiple gas limits (10,30,45,60,100,150) but we will focus only on upcoming target (100).

Dashboard will be from now on answering the question "Are we ready for 100MGas Gas Limit?" with an assumption that everything which is above 4sec execution time (so basically any scenario which performs worse than 25MGas/s) is current blocker for 100MGas.

Letting you know as you may see quite a big fluctuation of results (10MGas (so very low) was making results worse in general giving bad understanding of current performance - this is because of some extra addon for requests processing/networking etc)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> re: **@siladu**
> Why not 3 second window as we did with 60M blocks i.e. 33MGas/s for 100M?
Good question.

4 is an actual worst case barrier we should never be above.
3 is recommended - but if we are all below 4 sec barrier we can start thinking of a bump.

Machine is below hardware requirements so being below 4 is already good (where I also would prefer everyone to be below 4).
